channel.title: Why its time to say goodbye
channel.description:
[b]Intro:[/b] I'm sorry guys but it is time to say goodbye to game maker. As painful as it is for me to say that I have to.
[b]How it began[/b] This is what happened. I recently purchased GameMaker 8.1 Standard, and I loved it. Its extremely fast, powerful, and still good ol' game maker. Today, however, it crashed on me. I thought it was just because I was running too many things at once. So I closed everything and tried to re-open it. When I did so I got a strange error stating this: GM error code 68262. Every time I tried to open it I would get this message. Since I had the verification codes I simply uninstalled and re-installed it again. Once that was done I tried opening it once more. Again I got the error code. So I contacted the GM support staff and apparently I am not the first to receive this message. The said it has something to do with the reading between game maker and my computer and because of the error code It sends a message to the GM servers that do the updates or whatever for gamemaker and registered mine as a "no pro" what this means is that because of their mistake I am no longer able to have GameMaker on my computer! So now I am learning a new language called FreeBasic. Its actually quite powerful. I was amazed at how simple it is too.
[b]Closing Notes[/b] I guess I'm disappointed, but hey now I get to learn something new :)
NOTE: And yes they refunded my money to me.

item.title: Why its time to say goodbye
item.dc:creator: @xryz xryz
item.description:
@xryz wrote:

i didnt say it was programming i just said its a simple way to make android apps. the only real use drag n drop has for programming is making guis.

Read full topic
item.source: Why its time to say goodbye

item.title: Why its time to say goodbye
item.dc:creator: @GML_Programmer GML Programmer
item.description:
@GML_Programmer wrote:

Just purchased DB Pro and Im very pleased. The programming is awesome and easy to understand, Its amazingly powerful, Blizzard Entertainment uses it for WoW so you know its reliable. I still have to get used to it a little but its actually pretty similar to GML in its own kinda way. Anyways there is no Drag and Drop so people cant say its not programming anymore lol

Read full topic
item.source: Why its time to say goodbye

item.title: Why its time to say goodbye
item.dc:creator: @Andrew_Ferguson The317Guy
item.description:
@Andrew_Ferguson wrote:

[quote=“xryz, post:29, topic:400990”][quote author=Andrew Ferguson link=topic=498046.msg3642183#msg3642183 date=1309085151]

i havent looked into this much but it looked nice when i took a look at it. i would guess u would need to learn java if u dont already know it. http://jmonkeyengine.com/

off-topic a little, u can create android apps really easy and simple, with barely any programming knowledge, by using googles app inventor: http://appinventor.googlelabs.com/about/ . i brought it up b/c when i went to the scratch homepage and seen the building blocks it reminded me of open block(created by MIT) that google uses with the programming part of app inventor.
[/quote]Your an idiot. Thats for Android mobiles.

Plus no one wants to make a picture of a freekin cat that meows when you touch it.

if ur talking about app inventor, thats just a tutorial to learn how to use it. since its in beta u cant make what ever u want but u can make more than that cat app.[/quote]
Never the less, drag and drop programming is NOT programming, no ones going to buy an app you make with this thing unless they’re retarded.

Read full topic
item.source: Why its time to say goodbye

item.title: Why its time to say goodbye
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

I dunno Andrew… sounds kinda appealing.

[quote=“B2300 T4nk, post:21, topic:400990”]Scratch can’t be turned into an EXE. Plus, if you want somebody to play it, they will have the source code and they must have Scratch.[/quote]Nothing wrong with not being able to be turned into an EXE. I probably prefer games that can’t. That second part is a turn off though…
